intro: Tragacantha stocksii, commonly known as the yellow tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and distinctive seed pods. The plant produces a viscous gum, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Tragacantha stocksii thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in scrubland and woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and herbal applications.
